com.ragego.utils

Interface FormatIO

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardGameFormatIO

    public interface FormatIO
    Declare which actions could be performed by a IO Format. A reader is a class which could read and write. Each format should be used for Go files.
    Since:
    1.0

              GameBoard game)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Write game data to a file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to write in (erase previous data)
        game - The game to save
        Returns:

      • readRaw

        GameNode[] readRaw(java.io.File file)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Read raw data from a file. This functon is suitable to get a raw data from a file. The board snaps extracted are just representative of board at some given times.
        Parameters:
        file - File to read
        Returns:
        An array of sucessing position during the game. Index 0 is the first state and last index is the last state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        GameBoard read(java.io.File file,
               GameBoard game)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Load a file in a Game. Load a game in an empty GameBoard. This load data about players, positions, stones. If the format could not store this data, it should create default data.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to load
        game - An empty GameBoard (previous data could be erased)
        Returns:
        true on success, false on all other state. In case of IOException, throw the error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
